questions.question: The correct actions to be taken in the event of a carburettor fire on a piston engined aeroplane depend upon:
options: the type of fuel.
whether the engine has started.
the OAT.
the accessibility of a fire extinguisher.

questions.question: The initial actions to be taken in the event of an engine fire depend upon:
options: the type of engine.
whether the aeroplane is in the air or on the ground.
how many passengers are on board.
the availability of crash/fire crews.

questions.question: What equipment is required to be carried to combat the effects of smoke in the flight deck area?
options: Fire extinguishers.
A drop out oxygen system.
Smoke hoods with emergency 100% oxygen supply.
Battery operated torches.
questions.solution: Smoke hoods with emergency 100% oxygen supply.

questions.question: Would you use a dry powder extinguisher on a liquid fire in an aeroplane?
options: Yes, but not on the flight deck.
No, it is only for use on electrical fires.
Yes anywhere.
Yes, but only in confined spaces not accessible to passengers.
questions.solution: Yes, but not on the flight deck.

questions.question: Fire detection equipment fitted to aeroplanes is designed to:
options: detect fire and smoke by optical means.
detect heat by electrical means and smoke by optical means.
operate sprinkler systems.
operate fire alarms and automatically operate COâ‚‚ flooding of inaccessible spaces.
questions.solution: detect heat by electrical means and smoke by optical means.

questions.question: If an aeroplane is certificated for 6 passengers, how many hand-held fire extinguishers are required to be carried in the aeroplane?
options: Nil.
It depends upon the max take-off mass permitted.

questions.question: If an aeroplane is certificated for 10 passengers, how many hand-held fire extinguishers are required to be carried in the passenger compartment?
If the galley is not located on the main passenger deck:
options: the closest extinguisher in the passenger compartment must be not more than 10 metres from the galley.
the galley must have an automatic extinguisher system and fire detection system.
separate extinguishers suitable for both oil and solid fires are to be available in the galley.
at least one extinguisher is to be positioned in the galley.
questions.solution: at least one extinguisher is to be positioned in the galley.

questions.question: A crash axe and/or crowbar is/are required to be carried on the flight deck of aeroplanes:
options: in the public transport (passenger) role.
with a max take-off mass exceeding 5700 kg or 10 or more passenger seats.
with a max take-off mass of 5700 kg and 9 passenger seats.
that are carrying more than 200 passengers.
questions.solution: with a max take-off mass exceeding 5700 kg or 10 or more passenger seats.

questions.question:
Which combination of the following statements correctly identifies the problems associated with overheated brakes after a heavyweight landing or an aborted take-off?
1. Reduced braking efficiency.
2. Inadvertent operation of fire extinguishers.
3. Extended brake cooling time.
4. Inadvertent operation of brake overheat sensors.
5. Problems with heat dispersal.
6. Risk of tyre explosion.
options: All.
